memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1648

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public authorities law, in relation to and for the
purpose of enabling the dormitory authority to finance and provide
facilities for a research laboratory for epidemiology in the
borough of Brooklyn

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
To enable the dormitory authority to finance and provide facilities
for a research laboratory for epidemiology in the borough of Brooklyn.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
To amend the public authorities law to enable the dormitory authority
to finance, construct, reconstruct, improve, renovate or otherwise in
order to provide facilities for a research laboratory for
epidemiology in the borough of Brooklyn. Any contracts for design,
construction, services and materials entered into by the authority
pursuant to this act shall be deemed state contracts within the
meaning of that term as set forth in article 15-A of the executive
law, and the authority shall be deemed, for the purposes of this act,
a contracting agency as that term is used in Article 15-A of the
executive law.

EFFECTS OF PRESENT LAW WHICH THIS BILL WOULD ALTER:
Paragraph (b) of subdivision 2 of section 1676 of the public
authorities law is amended by adding a new undesignated subparagraph
and subdivision 1 of section 1680 of the public authorities law is
amended by adding a new undesignated paragraph.

JUSTIFICATION:
The County of Kings is the fourth largest county in the country and is
one of the largest populated counties in the State of New York. With
this in mind, Kings county experiences very high rates of communicable
and infectious diseases, and mental disorders. Such issues are
consistent in relation to the large demographics. However we need to
address these health care issues. With the spread of AIDS on the
rise, coupled with the outbreak of tuberculosis and a high incidence
rate of diseases, mental illness, and handicapping conditions, I
strongly recommend consideration for the development of a research
laboratory for epidemiology in Kings County. Through the development
of such a facility we can begin to meet the urgent needs of the
Brooklyn community for well-educated health care workers and
enhanced health and human services. This center can conduct clinical
and basic research and analysis on the prevention, cure and treatment
of diseases and financed through the Dormitory Authority, the Health
Income Fund and the general fund. With the implementation of such an
initiative we can improve the health services in high health-risk and
economically disadvantaged areas.
Additionally, this initiative will clearly address the t,>Towing need

for clinical research of various diseases, while simultaneously
providing economic opportunities to the residents of Brooklyn, the
City of New York and the State of New York.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.1904 of 2007
01/29/07 Referred to Corporations, Authorities & Commissions

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall become effective immediately.
